questions.question: A deterministic signal is characterized by:
options: Exact values from a mathematical formula
questions.explanation: Deterministic signals have exact values that can be calculated from an explicit formula.

questions.question: Which is a random signal?
questions.explanation: Thermal noise is inherently random with no formula to predict exact values.

questions.question: SNR stands for:
questions.explanation: SNR = Signal-to-Noise Ratio = Signal Power / Noise Power.

questions.question: An SNR of 20 dB means the signal is ___ times stronger than noise.
Speech signals are classified as:
questions.explanation: Speech varies randomly even for the same person saying the same word.

questions.question: For a deterministic signal, the probability of its value equals:
questions.explanation: Deterministic signals have probability = 1 for their calculated values.

questions.question: Random signals are described using:
questions.explanation: Random signals are characterized by their probability density functions and statistics.

questions.question: In communication, y(t) = x(t) + n(t) means:
questions.explanation: This is the standard model: received = transmitted + noise.

questions.question: Why study deterministic signals first?
questions.explanation: Deterministic analysis is mathematically tractable and forms the foundation for random signal analysis.

questions.question: Gaussian noise is characterized by:
questions.explanation: Gaussian noise follows the normal (bell-shaped) probability distribution.
